data.title: Gombe State
data.meta_description: Gombe State is in the north-eastern region of Nigeria. It shares common boundaries with Adamawa and Taraba State to the south, Bauchi State to the west, Borno State to the east and Yobe State to the north.
data.text:
Cancer Cases in FMC Gombe Cancer Registry

The Gombe Cancer Registry reported a total 1833 cases of cancer in the 8-year period from 2009 to 2016. A total of 1,077 (58.8%) were reported in females and 756 (41.2%) in males.

shows the distribution of cases by year. The average number of cases observed per year during the 8-year period was 267.

The highest percentage of cancer cases in females was breast cancer (33.5%; 340 cases) followed by cancer of the cervix (17.9%; 181 cases) as shown in . Together, these two cancers account for 48.4% of all cancers occurring in females in the area covered by the FMC Gombe Cancer Registry.

The highest percentage of cancer cases in males was prostate cancer (22.4%; 149 cases) followed by non-melanoma skin cancers (10.8%; 72 cases) as shown in . Together, these two cancers account for 30.0% of all cancers occurring in males in FMC Gombe Cancer Registry.

The shows the new cancer cases by age group among females from ages 0 to 85+ years within the 8-year period, while The shows the new cancer cases by age group among males from ages 0 to 85+ years within the 8-year period.
